text: Riccardo Giacconi (October 6, 1931 - December 9, 2018) was an Italian-American astrophysicist and educator. He won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 2002. He was awarded the prize because he laid the foundations of X-ray astronomy.Nobel prize citation He was a professor at the Johns Hopkins University.
